package-sizes.question: What package sizes are WIC-approved?
package-sizes.answer:
WIC approves specific package sizes for each food category. This is one of the most common reasons items get rejected at checkout.

**General Rules:**
‚Ä¢ Each state's Approved Product List (APL) specifies exact sizes
‚Ä¢ Size must match EXACTLY ‚Äî close isn't good enough
‚Ä¢ Multi-packs may have different rules than single items

**Michigan Examples:**
‚Ä¢ Milk: 1/2 gallon or gallon (not quarts)
‚Ä¢ Eggs: 1 dozen only (not 18-count)
‚Ä¢ Cheese: 8 oz or 16 oz blocks (varies by type)
‚Ä¢ Cereal: 12-36 oz boxes (varies by brand)
‚Ä¢ Juice: 64 oz bottles (frozen may differ)

**Pro Tip:** Use this app's scanner to verify! It checks both the product AND the size against your state's current APL.

checkout-rejected.question: Why was my item rejected at checkout?
checkout-rejected.answer:
Items can be rejected at checkout for several reasons, even if they seem like they should be WIC-approved:

**Most Common Reasons:**

1. **Wrong Size** ‚Äî The exact package size isn't on the APL
   ‚Ä¢ Example: 24 oz cereal when only 18 oz is approved

2. **Wrong Brand** ‚Äî Store brand vs name brand matters
   ‚Ä¢ Some items require specific brands
   ‚Ä¢ Formula is especially strict about brands

3. **Wrong Variety** ‚Äî Same brand, different product
   ‚Ä¢ Example: Cheerios ‚úì but Honey Nut Cheerios ‚úó
   ‚Ä¢ Example: 2% milk ‚úì but chocolate milk ‚úó

4. **Benefits Exhausted** ‚Äî Already used your allowance
   ‚Ä¢ Check your remaining benefits in the app

5. **Benefits Expired** ‚Äî Past your benefit period end date

6. **Store System Error** ‚Äî Rare, but happens
   ‚Ä¢ Ask the cashier to re-scan or try another register

**What to Do:**
‚Ä¢ Don't argue at checkout ‚Äî it's stressful and rarely helps
‚Ä¢ Note the item and check it in this app later
‚Ä¢ Ask for a manager if you believe it's a store error
‚Ä¢ Contact your WIC office if it keeps happening

formula-stock.question: How do I know if formula is in stock?
formula-stock.answer:
Finding formula in stock can be challenging, especially during shortages. Here's how to check:

**Using This App:**
1. Go to the Formula Finder from the home screen
2. Select your formula type
3. See stores with recent stock reports
4. Check confidence scores (higher = more recent/reliable reports)

**Other Methods:**
‚Ä¢ Call the store before going
‚Ä¢ Check store websites/apps (Walmart, Target, etc.)
‚Ä¢ Ask your WIC office ‚Äî they sometimes get shortage updates

**Understanding Stock Reports:**
‚Ä¢ üü¢ "Plenty" ‚Äî Multiple units available
‚Ä¢ üü° "Some" ‚Äî A few units spotted
‚Ä¢ üü† "Few" ‚Äî Very limited, go soon
‚Ä¢ üî¥ "Out" ‚Äî None seen

**Report What You See:**
Help other parents! When you shop, report formula stock in the app. Your report helps build a community picture of what's available.

**Formula Shortage Tips:**
‚Ä¢ Check multiple stores in your area
‚Ä¢ Go early in the morning when shelves are restocked
‚Ä¢ Ask about delivery schedules
‚Ä¢ Consider equivalent formulas (ask your WIC office first)

benefit-states.question: What do Available, In Cart, and Consumed mean?
benefit-states.answer:
Your benefits have three states that help you track usage:

**üü¢ Available (Green)**
Benefits you can still use. This is your spending power.

**üü† In Cart (Amber)**
Items you've added to your cart but haven't purchased yet. This helps you plan your trip without over-buying.

**‚¨ú Consumed (Gray)**
Benefits you've already used this period. These are spent.

**How It Works:**
1. Start of month: All benefits are Available
2. Add items to cart: Moves from Available ‚Üí In Cart
3. Log a purchase: Moves from In Cart ‚Üí Consumed
4. Remove from cart: Moves back from In Cart ‚Üí Available

**Why This Matters:**
‚Ä¢ Prevents embarrassment at checkout from over-shopping
‚Ä¢ Helps plan shopping trips
‚Ä¢ Shows at a glance what you have left

benefit-period.question: When do my benefits expire?
benefit-period.answer:
WIC benefits expire at the end of each benefit period:

**Key Facts:**
‚Ä¢ Benefits are typically monthly
‚Ä¢ Unused benefits do NOT roll over
‚Ä¢ Your period dates are set by your WIC office

**Check Your Dates:**
Go to Benefits ‚Üí look at the expiration date under each category

**Don't Lose Benefits:**
‚Ä¢ Shop before the end date
‚Ä¢ Check remaining amounts regularly
‚Ä¢ Plan your trips to use everything

**Tip:** Set a reminder a few days before your period ends to use remaining benefits.

scan-products.question: How do I scan products to check eligibility?
scan-products.answer:
Use the scanner to verify products BEFORE checkout:

**How to Scan:**
1. Tap "Scan Product" on the home screen
2. Point your camera at the barcode
3. Hold steady until it beeps
4. See instant eligibility results

**What You'll See:**
‚Ä¢ ‚úÖ Eligible ‚Äî Good to buy with WIC
‚Ä¢ ‚ùå Not Eligible ‚Äî Won't work with WIC benefits
‚Ä¢ ‚ö†Ô∏è Check Size ‚Äî Product is WIC-approved but verify the size

**Tips:**
‚Ä¢ Scan in the store while shopping
‚Ä¢ Check items you're unsure about
‚Ä¢ Works offline with Michigan products

formula-alternatives.question: Can I get a different formula if mine is out of stock?
formula-alternatives.answer:
You may be able to substitute formula, but there are rules:

**Important:** Always contact your WIC office before switching formulas, especially for medical formulas.

**General Guidelines:**
‚Ä¢ Same brand, different size: Usually OK
‚Ä¢ Different brand, same type: May need approval
‚Ä¢ Different formula type: Requires WIC office approval
‚Ä¢ Medical/specialty formulas: ALWAYS need approval

**Contract Brand:**
Your state has a "contract brand" that's the default. Switching between contract brand products is usually easier than switching to other brands.

**Michigan Contract Brand:** Currently Similac (as of 2024)

**How to Request a Change:**
1. Call your local WIC office
2. Explain the shortage situation
3. They can update your benefits for approved alternatives

**In the App:**
The Formula Finder shows alternative formulas that may work for your situation.

manual-entry.question: How do I enter my benefits manually?
manual-entry.answer:
If automatic benefit loading isn't available, you can enter benefits from your WIC printout:

**Steps:**
1. Go to Benefits screen
2. Tap "Add Benefits Manually"
3. Select the participant
4. Choose the benefit category
5. Enter the amount from your printout
6. Set your benefit period dates

**Where to Find Your Amounts:**
‚Ä¢ Your WIC benefits printout (given at appointments)
‚Ä¢ Your eWIC card receipt
‚Ä¢ Your state's WIC app or website

**Tip:** Enter benefits right after your WIC appointment when you have the printout handy.

household-setup.question: How do I set up my household?
household-setup.answer:
Set up your household to track benefits for everyone:

**Steps:**
1. Go to Benefits screen
2. Tap "Setup" or "Set Up Household"
3. Add each participant (pregnant, infant, child, etc.)
4. Enter their name and type
5. Add their benefits

**Participant Types:**
‚Ä¢ Pregnant
‚Ä¢ Postpartum (not breastfeeding)
‚Ä¢ Breastfeeding
‚Ä¢ Infant (0-12 months)
‚Ä¢ Child (1-5 years)

**Why It Matters:**
Different participants get different benefits. Setting this up correctly ensures accurate tracking.

report-sighting.question: How do I report product availability?
report-sighting.answer:
Help other WIC families by reporting what you see in stores:

**How to Report:**
1. Scan a product
2. Tap "Report Stock"
3. Select your store
4. Choose stock level (Plenty, Some, Few, Out)
5. Submit

**Stock Levels:**
‚Ä¢ üü¢ Plenty ‚Äî Good supply, multiple units
‚Ä¢ üü° Some ‚Äî Moderate amount
‚Ä¢ üü† Few ‚Äî Very limited
‚Ä¢ üî¥ Out ‚Äî None available

**Why Report:**
‚Ä¢ Helps other parents find products
‚Ä¢ Builds community knowledge
‚Ä¢ Reduces wasted trips
‚Ä¢ Especially valuable for formula!

**Your reports are anonymous** and help families across your area.
